info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:56PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Elbert, southern Abbeville and Greenwood Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 555 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Greenwood to near Elberton. Movement was east-southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenwood, Abbeville, Elberton, Calhoun Falls, Ninety Six, Troy, Bobby Brown State Park, Ninety Six Historic Site, Lake Strom Thurmond and Nancy Hart State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
